wiki.summary: On “Emotionless,” Drake ultimately acknowledges the existence of his child, Adonis. While Drake having a child was rumored in early 2017, Pusha-T’s “The Story of Adidon” brought these rumors to the forefront during their past feud. Around a week prior to the release of "Scorpion", billboards were posted to promote the album. One of the messages read a direct line from this song, “DON’T HIT ME WHEN YOU HEAR THIS.” This song includes a sample of Mariah Carey’s 1991 song “Emotions. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: On “Emotionless,” Drake ultimately acknowledges the existence of his child, Adonis. While Drake having a child was rumored in early 2017, Pusha-T’s “The Story of Adidon” brought these rumors to the forefront during their past feud. Around a week prior to the release of "Scorpion", billboards were posted to promote the album. One of the messages read a direct line from this song, “DON’T HIT ME WHEN YOU HEAR THIS.” This song includes a sample of Mariah Carey’s 1991 song “Emotions.” In an interview with Genius, she spoke on her thoughts about its use: "I heard it over the phone at first, and I was like, ‘Oh, I’m sure they’re gonna speed it up. This is probably just a little snippet of what they’re gonna do. They ended up using pretty much all of it. I was like, ‘Okay, well, I’m so glad they liked it.’ I was very flattered by it." “Emotionless” debuted at #8 on the Billboard Hot 100 on the chart week of July 14, 2018. It stayed on the chart for four weeks before departing. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
